basics.name: GUAN-WEI LI
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Dedicated software engineer with expertise in web development, blockchain, and bioinformatics. Passionate about learning, interdisciplinary challenges, and innovative software solutions.

work.name: International Cooperation and Development Fund
work.summary: Improved HIS and HAPI FHIR synchronization speed, enhancing system efficiency and data interoperability, crucial for advancing TaiwanICDF's global health initiatives.

work.name: 攻誠投創有限公司(Advertising Company)
work.summary: Developed and maintained blockchain applications, designed user-friendly web interfaces, and enhanced system functionalities through API development and integration at 攻誠投創有限公司.

work.name: National Taiwan University
work.summary: Conducted zebrafish behavioral studies, performed data analysis with Python and OCTAVE, and conducted genome-wide association studies (GWAS) using Python and Plink at NTU.

education.area: Graduate Institute of Biomedical Electronics and Bioinformatics
courses: Genome-wide Association Study of Hypertension in Taiwanese Population

certificates.name: Participated in an information security series organized by NTU's Computing Center
Participated in an information security series organized by NTU's Computing Center

publications.name: Genome-wide Association Study of Hypertension in Taiwanese Population
publications.summary: Conducted a comprehensive genome-wide association analysis to identify novel genetic loci associated with hypertension in the Taiwanese population. Utilized Axiom Genome-Wide Array Chip, analyzed 4,512,191 SNPs, identified 1,033 significant SNPs including 14 risk loci, and performed gene- based association analysis using MAGMA and MetaXcan tools to uncover significant genes associated with hypertension.

projects.name: HIS-ELK
projects.summary: Implemented ELK stack for real-time monitoring of HIS systems.

projects.name: HL7 FHIR (Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources) Electronic Medical Record Information
projects.summary: Improve the sharing and application scenarios of electronic medical records using HL7 FHIR (Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources)

projects.name: SNAKE
projects.summary: Offer emergency response solutions for snake bites.
